sentence.Network_en: Instead of moving at his usual stately pace, he was almost running.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没像平时那样优雅庄重地走着，而是几乎跑了起来。

sentence.Network_en: The building rose before him, tall and stately.
sentence.Network_cn: 那座高大宏伟的建筑耸立在他面前。

entry.tran: 雄伟的;庄严的;高贵的;优雅的
entry.def: Something or someone that is stately is impressive and graceful or dignified.

example.ex: Instead of moving at his usual stately pace, he was almost running.
example.tran: 他没像平时那样优雅庄重地走着，而是几乎跑了起来。

means.word_mean: 2. of size and dignity suggestive of a statue
3. refined or imposing in manner or appearance; befitting a royal court;

auth_sentence.content: A tall, blonde woman, slender, and stately.
auth_sentence.res_content: A tall, blonde woman, slender, and stately.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A tall, blonde woman, slender, and stately.

auth_sentence.content: Tall, stately...she possessed a very aristocratic mien.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tall, stately...she possessed a very aristocratic mien.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Tall, stately...she possessed a very aristocratic mien.

auth_sentence.content: The Duke...With slow but stately pace kept on his course.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Duke...With slow but stately pace kept on his course.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Duke...With slow but stately pace kept on his course.

sentences.en: The stately swan glides gracefully on the pond.
sentences.cn: 天鹅在池面上优美地游动。

sentences.en: The procession moved at a slow and stately speed.
sentences.cn: 队伍以缓缓而庄严的速度行进。

sentences.en: Priceless antique furniture was destroyed in the fire at the stately home.
sentences.cn: 那座富丽堂皇的宅第里价值连城的古董家具在大火中付之一炬了。
